Suns focusing on Ricky Rubio, not D’Angelo Russell?
According to Zach Lowe of ESPN, the Suns are actually focusing on veteran floor general Ricky Rubio. Lowe adds that Phoenix will look at Russell, who’s close with Devin Booker, but Rubio seems to be the main target. The Suns currently only have about $14 million in cap room, making Rubio a more feasible target.
The 28-year-old Rubio spent the first six years of his NBA career in Minnesota before being traded to Utah during the summer of 2017. 
He is coming off a 2018/19 campaign with the Utah Jazz in which he played 68 games and averaged 12.7 points, 6.1 assists, 3.6 rebounds and 1.3 steals per game.

轉寄

「我知道每個人都有自己的看法，他們覺得我們應該怎麼做，球員或選秀權的價值應該有多少。」James Jones說：「這些批評都是對的，但我認為只要他們理解我們現在正在建立的是一支球隊，而不是最大化累積所謂的資產，尤其考慮我們獲得的，我想他們能理解我們已經完成的交易都很棒，整支球隊也改善了。」

「我們的目標是得到一名好球員，一名控球後衛，同時也要保持未來幾年的團隊薪資彈性和成熟度，如果你檢視我們的交易，Josh Jackson擁有偉大的天賦，但他還是個年輕人，T.J. Warren已經來到職業生涯的另一個階段，而小前鋒的位置上我們已經有太多人。」James Jones說：「我們還有Mikal Bridges、有Kelly Oubre、有Cameron Johnson，無論Warren是否還能提供我們需要的貢獻，或者把機會讓給其他需要培養的球員，就變成我們必須為了團隊利益而必須做的決定，我並沒有剝奪他們打球的機會，但對於球隊來說，這是最好的交易。」

在稍早接受Arizona Sports訪問時，由於之前幾筆帳面上看起來很糟糕的交易被罵，James Jones也為他的交易做出辯解，當然，這確實有他的邏輯，至少墊高地板這件事無論如何也不能說錯，因此這也是為什麼我一直沒怎麼表態的主因，反正講到最後，還是用開季後的成績來說話的。

「很多時候我都認為人們過度看重天賦，他們在泡沫中看待天賦，而這樣的天賦我們以前已經有很多了。」James Jones說：「我認為現在是近年來我們第一次擁有真正的整體天賦，我們隊員的天賦可以完美互補。」

The Phoenix Suns are evidently ‘running out of fans,’ according to a report by 24/7 Wall Street.

The site did a story, via USA TODAY Sports, that used sports attendance data from ESPN to find the pro sports franchises that saw an attendance decline of at least 10% from the 2008 season to the 2018 season.

The Suns came in at No. 9 on the list with an average home attendance drop of 17 percent from 2008-18.

The study listed the Suns' average home attendance in 2008-09 at 18,422, which was 100% capacity at their arena.

Last season, the team's average home attendance was at 15,293, 83% capacity at their arena.

Phoenix went 46-36 in 2008, the first year in the report’s study. The team went just 19-63 in the most recent year in the study, the 2018 season.

The Suns are the only NBA team on the list.

I'm a fan of Devin Booker. He was certainly an exciting slam dunker who was worth his weight in gold to Suns. Don't get me wrong- i still enjoy watching him play even though he's past his prime. He proved his worth to Suns by helping win multiple championships. His worth to the team was incalculable. I must say he's made significant progress with his free throw shootings over the last four and a half months. Unfortunately his leg injury has progressed fairly quickly causing him to be sidelined for half a year through injury. He has a follow-up to the doctor next week. His friend LeBron James will also be out of commission until his back heals. He's made little progress with his shootings since he injured his back. His doctor said he was making good progress and will check on his progress next month. He assigned the blame for his back injury to a lack of stretching and training. Oh well, it could be worse. His worth of contribution to Lakers is incalculable. Lakers is as likely to win the final next year as Warriros in my opinion. Just the other month Lakers didn't just beat bulls. They wiped the floor with them. Everyone was on the edge of their seats. Bulls lost its edge to some extent after their scoring leader John left the team. Raptors edged out Bulls by two points. It reminds me of Warriors edging out Cavaliers by four points. The role of every coach in every team is well defined. Everybody has a vital role to play in every team. In addition, the government has established a commission to investigate the use of steroids among players. Another commission has also be created to examine family violence in NBA which I wholeheartedly support. There's a gym near Phoenix Suns' official arena: Talking Stick Resort Arena in Phoenix. The membership cost is eighty seven dollars a month which is well worth it for the wide range of facilities you can use. They sell a tub of whey protein for fifty six dollars which is worth it as it's normally three times as expensive. The cost of a tub of soy protein has edged down from forty to thirty four dollars whereas the cost of casein protein has edged up from sixty to sixty three dollars. The cost of creatine has edged higher by five dollars while that of weight gainer has edged lower by three dollars.
